Questions.QuestionText:
Calculate

  1. Calculate a Hobbled roman shade outside mount
  2. Window: 60" wide by 48" long with 6" trim added to the window size
  3. Hange 6" above the top trim on a velcro board
  4. 8' ceiling
  5. Plain fabric
  6. Lining and interlining needed?

What are the steps to complete the calculations for this window treatment?
Questions.AnswerText:
Draw ½" scale drawing on graph paper as your working copy.

Width:

  1. Outside mount means that the treatment will extend 2" past the trim.
  2. Window width = 60" window outside mount on a Velcro board.
  3. 2" past trim + 6" trim + 60" window + 6" trim + 2" past = 76" + 6" selvage = 82" total width needed.
  4. Do not include selvage in finished width: 82" - 6" = 76" finished width".
  5. Since fabric is 54" wide, you need to see how many cuts of 54" fabric you need to allow for 82" of width.
  6. 82" / 54" = 1.5 cuts. Round up to the next full cut size = 2 cuts of 54" fabric to sew together to make the width needed for this treatment.

Length

  1. Since outside mount measure 6" above trim + 6" trim + 48" length of window + 6" bottom trim + 2" below trim = 68" finished length.
  2. This is not the amount to order. Hobbled roman shade style needs 2.5 times this length to make (included hem and header).
  3. 68" finished length x 2.5 = 170" in length to order.
  4. We need 2 cuts of fabric to make this treatment: 170" length X 2 cuts = 340" of fabric to order / 36" = 9.44 yards of fabric. Round up to 9 ½ to 9 ¾ yards to order.
  5. Lining: Same amount of lining and interlining needed to order.
  6. An interlining is a recommended option to give more body to the folds and give a more custom look to the treatment.
